sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a regular polygon.
message_1: A regular polygon has 9 sides, each measuring 5 cm. What is the perimeter of this polygon?
message_2:
To find the perimeter of a regular polygon, we simply multiply the length of one side by the number of sides. In this case, the polygon has 9 sides, each measuring 5 cm. So, the perimeter is:

Perimeter = (Number of sides) × (Length of one side)
Perimeter = 9 × 5 cm
Perimeter = 45 cm

The perimeter of this regular polygon is 45 cm.
